course.subject: HART
course.name: Connecting Acting with Public Speaking
course.description: This course introduces the basic concepts of theatre performance. Through theatre games, improvisation and in-class weekly based practices, students could explore their own potentials, creativities and train their senses. Since speaking is one of the major requirements for an actor, this course also examines the aspects of voice production and public speaking skills. Students will learn to free their voice and examine the intimacy between voice and acting.

reviews.author: Duy Pham
reviews.comment_content: The content is interesting, spanning from public speaking, meditation, controlling mind and actions, ... It's a class that I can enjoy learning new content without worrying much about grading.
reviews.comment_teaching: The instructor is very friendly. She is caring about students and questioning whenever you are absent from class. You can ask her anything about life as well.
reviews.comment_grading:
I have not received the grading yet, however, according to the instructor, she will not make the grading for this course as the burden for students.

Attendance is quite important for this course.
reviews.comment_workload: Light workload, no homework. We just need to have the final performance (1' monologue) and a reflection on what we have studied throughout the course.
